paper_abstract: We discuss a new direction in which the use of some methods from arithmetic combinatorics can be extended. We consider functions taking values in Euclidean space and supported on subsets of {1,2,...,N}. In this context we present a proof of a natural generalization of Szemeredi's theorem. We also prove a similar generalization of a theorem of Sarkozy using a vector-valued Fourier transform, adapting an argument of Green and obtaining effective bounds.
paper_title: Structure Along Arithmetic Patterns in Sequences of Vectors
